verses.verse: And he went<WG1831> out from there,<WG1564> and came<WG2064> into<WG1519> his own country;<WG3968> and his disciples<WG3101> follow<WG190> him.

And when the sabbath<WG4521> day was come,<WG1096> he began<WG756> to teach<WG1321> in the synagogue:<WG4864> and many<WG4183> hearing<WG191> him were astonished,<WG1605> saying,<WG3004> From where<WG4159> has this<WG5129> man these<WG5023> things? and what<WG5101> wisdom<WG4678> is this<WG3588> which is given<WG1325> to him, that even<WG2532> such<WG5108> mighty<WG1411> works are worked<WG1096> by his hands?<WG5495>

Is not this<WG3778> the carpenter,<WG5045> the son<WG5207> of Mary,<WG3137> the brother<WG80> of James,<WG2385> and Joses,<WG2500> and of Juda,<WG2455> and Simon?<WG4613> and are not his sisters<WG79> here<WG5602> with us? And they were offended<WG4624> at<WG1722> him.
But Jesus,<WG2424> said<WG3004> to them, A prophet<WG4396> is not without<WG820> honor,<WG820> but in his own country,<WG3968> and among<WG1722> his own kin,<WG4773> and in his own house. <WG3614>
And he could<WG1410> there<WG1563> do<WG4160> no<WG3762> mighty<WG1411> work,<WG1411> save<WG1508> that he laid<WG2007> his hands<WG5495> on a few<WG3641> sick<WG732> folk, and healed<WG2323> them.
And he marveled<WG2296> because<WG1223> of their unbelief.<WG570> And he went<WG4013> round<WG2943> about<WG2945> the villages,<WG2968> teaching.<WG1321>

And he called<WG4341> to him the twelve,<WG1427> and began<WG756> to send<WG649> them forth<WG1614> by two<WG1417> and two;<WG1417> and gave<WG1325> them power<WG1849> over unclean<WG169> spirits;<WG4151>

And commanded<WG3853> them that they should take<WG142> nothing<WG3367> for their journey,<WG3598> save<WG1508> a staff<WG4464> only;<WG3440> no<WG3361> money,<WG4082> no<WG3361> bread,<WG740> no<WG3361> money<WG5475> in their purse:<WG2223>
But be shod<WG5265> with sandals;<WG4547> and not put<WG1746> on<WG1746> two<WG1417> coats.<WG5509>

And he said<WG3004> to them, In what<WG3699> place<WG3699> soever<WG1437> you enter<WG1525> into<WG1519> an house,<WG3614> there<WG1563> abide<WG3306> till<WG2193> you depart<WG1831> from that place. <WG1564>

And whoever <WG3745> <WG302> shall not receive<WG1209> you, nor<WG3366> hear<WG191> you, when you depart<WG1607> there,<WG1564> shake<WG1621> off<WG1621> the dust<WG5522> under<WG5270> your<WG5216> feet<WG4228> for a testimony<WG3142> against them. Truly<WG281> I say<WG3004> to you, It shall be more<WG414> tolerable<WG414> for Sodom<WG4670> and Gomorrha<WG1116> in the day<WG2250> of judgment,<WG2920> than<WG2228> for that city. <WG4172>
And they went<WG1831> out, and preached<WG2784> that men should repent.<WG3340>
And they cast<WG1544> out many<WG4183> devils,<WG1140> and anointed<WG218> with oil<WG1637> many<WG4183> that were sick,<WG732> and healed<WG2323> them.

And king<WG935> Herod<WG2264> heard<WG191> of him; (for his name<WG3686> was spread<WG5318> abroad:<WG1519> <WG1096>) and he said,<WG3004> That John<WG2491> the Baptist<WG907> was risen<WG1453> from the dead,<WG3498> and therefore<WG1223> <WG5124> mighty<WG1411> works do show<WG1754> forth<WG1754> themselves in him.
Others<WG243> said,<WG3004> That it is Elias.<WG2243> And others<WG243> said,<WG3004> That it is a prophet,<WG4396> or<WG2228> as one<WG1520> of the prophets.<WG4396>
But when Herod<WG2264> heard<WG191> thereof, he said,<WG2036> It is John,<WG2491> whom<WG3739> I beheaded:<WG607> he is risen<WG1453> from the dead.<WG3498>

For Herod<WG2264> himself<WG846> had sent<WG649> forth<WG1614> and laid hold<WG2902> on John,<WG2491> and bound<WG1210> him in prison<WG5438> for Herodias'<WG2266> sake, his brother<WG80> Philip's<WG5376> wife:<WG1135> for he had married<WG1060> her.
For John<WG2491> had said<WG3004> to Herod,<WG2264> It is not lawful<WG1832> for you to have<WG2192> your brother's<WG80> wife.<WG1135>
Therefore Herodias<WG2266> had a quarrel<WG1758> against him, and would<WG2309> have killed<WG615> him; but she could<WG1410> not:

For Herod<WG2264> feared<WG5399> John,<WG2491> knowing<WG1492> that he was a just<WG1342> man<WG435> and an holy,<WG40> and observed<WG4933> him; and when he heard<WG191> him, he did<WG4160> many<WG4183> things, and heard<WG191> him gladly.<WG2234>

And when a convenient<WG2121> day<WG2250> was come,<WG1096> that Herod<WG2264> on his birthday<WG1077> made<WG4160> a supper<WG1173> to his lords,<WG3175> high<WG5310> captains,<WG5506> and chief<WG4413> estates of Galilee;<WG1056>

And when the daughter<WG2364> of the said<WG846> Herodias<WG2266> came<WG1525> in, and danced,<WG3738> and pleased<WG700> Herod<WG2264> and them that sat<WG4873> with him, the king<WG935> said<WG2036> to the damsel,<WG2877> Ask<WG154> of me whatever<WG3739> <WG1437> you will,<WG2309> and I will give<WG1325> it you.
And he swore<WG3660> to her, Whatever<WG3739> <WG1437> you shall ask<WG154> of me, I will give<WG1325> it you, to the half<WG2255> of my kingdom.<WG932>
And she went<WG1831> forth,<WG1831> and said<WG2036> to her mother,<WG3384> What<WG5101> shall I ask?<WG154> And she said,<WG2036> The head<WG2776> of John<WG2491> the Baptist.<WG910>

And she came<WG1525> in straightway<WG2112> with haste<WG4710> to the king,<WG935> and asked,<WG154> saying,<WG3004> I will<WG2309> that you give<WG1325> me by and by in a charger<WG4094> the head<WG2776> of John<WG2491> the Baptist.<WG910>
And the king<WG935> was exceeding<WG4036> sorry;<WG4036> yet for his oath's<WG3727> sake, and for their sakes which<WG3588> sat<WG4873> with him, he would<WG2309> not reject<WG114> her.

And immediately<WG2112> the king<WG935> sent<WG649> an executioner,<WG4688> and commanded<WG2004> his head<WG2776> to be brought:<WG5342> and he went<WG565> and beheaded<WG607> him in the prison,<WG5438>
And brought<WG5342> his head<WG2776> in a charger,<WG4094> and gave<WG1325> it to the damsel:<WG2877> and the damsel<WG2877> gave<WG1325> it to her mother.<WG3384>
And when his disciples<WG3101> heard<WG191> of it, they came<WG2064> and took<WG142> up his corpse,<WG4430> and laid<WG5087> it in a tomb.<WG3419>

And the apostles<WG652> gathered<WG4863> themselves together<WG4863> to Jesus,<WG2424> and told<WG518> him all<WG3956> things, both<WG5037> what<WG3745> they had done,<WG4160> and what<WG3745> they had taught.<WG2258> <WG1321>

And he said<WG2036> to them, Come<WG1205> you yourselves <WG5210> <WG846> apart <WG2596> <WG2398> into<WG1519> a desert<WG2048> place,<WG5117> and rest<WG373> a while: <WG3641> for there were many<WG4183> coming<WG2064> and going,<WG5217> and they had no<WG3761> leisure<WG2119> so<WG3761> much as to eat.<WG5315>
And they departed<WG565> into<WG1519> a desert<WG2048> place<WG5117> by ship<WG4143> privately.<WG2596> <WG2398>

And the people<WG3793> saw<WG1492> them departing,<WG5217> and many<WG4183> knew<WG1921> him, and ran<WG4936> afoot<WG3979> thither<WG1563> out of all<WG3956> cities,<WG4172> and preceded<WG4281> them, and came<WG4905> together<WG4905> to him.

And Jesus,<WG2424> when he came<WG1831> out, saw<WG1492> much<WG4183> people,<WG3793> and was moved<WG4697> with compassion<WG4697> toward<WG1909> them, because<WG3754> they were as sheep<WG4263> not having<WG2192> a shepherd:<WG4166> and he began<WG756> to teach<WG1321> them many<WG4183> things.

And when the day<WG5610> was now<WG2235> far<WG4183> spent, his disciples<WG3101> came<WG4334> to him, and said,<WG3004> This<WG3588> is a desert<WG2048> place,<WG5117> and now<WG2235> the time<WG5610> is far<WG4183> passed:

Send<WG630> them away,<WG630> that they may go<WG565> into<WG1519> the country<WG68> round<WG2943> about,<WG2945> and into<WG1519> the villages,<WG2968> and buy<WG59> themselves<WG1438> bread:<WG740> for they have<WG2192> nothing<WG3756> <WG5100> to eat.<WG5315>

He answered<WG611> and said<WG2036> to them, Give<WG1325> you them to eat. <WG5315> And they say<WG3004> to him, Shall we go<WG565> and buy<WG59> two<WG1250> hundred<WG1250> pennyworth<WG1220> of bread,<WG740> and give<WG1325> them to eat?<WG5315>

He said<WG3004> to them, How<WG4214> many<WG4214> loaves<WG740> have<WG2192> you? go<WG5217> and see. <WG1492> And when they knew,<WG1097> they say,<WG3004> Five,<WG4002> and two<WG1417> fishes.<WG2486>
And he commanded<WG2004> them to make<WG347> all<WG3956> sit<WG347> down<WG347> by companies<WG4849> on the green<WG5515> grass.<WG5528>
And they sat<WG377> down<WG377> in ranks,<WG4237> by hundreds,<WG1540> and by fifties.<WG4004>

And when he had taken<WG2983> the five<WG4002> loaves<WG740> and the two<WG1417> fishes,<WG2486> he looked<WG308> up to heaven,<WG3772> and blessed,<WG2127> and broke<WG2622> the loaves,<WG740> and gave<WG1325> them to his disciples<WG3101> to set<WG3908> before<WG3908> them; and the two<WG1417> fishes<WG2486> divided<WG3307> he among them all.<WG3956>
And they did all<WG3956> eat,<WG5315> and were filled.<WG5526>
And they took<WG142> up twelve<WG1427> baskets<WG2894> full<WG4134> of the fragments,<WG2801> and of the fishes.<WG2486>
And they that did eat<WG5315> of the loaves<WG740> were about<WG5616> five<WG4000> thousand<WG4000> men.<WG435>

And straightway<WG2112> he constrained<WG315> his disciples<WG3101> to get<WG1684> into<WG1519> the ship,<WG4143> and to go<WG4254> to the other<WG4008> side<WG4008> before<WG4254> to Bethsaida,<WG966> while<WG2193> he sent<WG630> away<WG630> the people.<WG3793>
And when he had sent<WG657> them away,<WG657> he departed<WG565> into<WG1519> a mountain<WG3735> to pray.<WG4336>
And when even<WG3798> was come,<WG1096> the ship<WG4143> was in the middle<WG3319> of the sea,<WG2281> and he alone<WG3441> on<WG1909> the land.<WG1095>

And he saw<WG1492> them toiling<WG928> in rowing;<WG1643> for the wind<WG417> was contrary<WG1727> to them: and about<WG4012> the fourth<WG5067> watch<WG5438> of the night<WG3571> he comes<WG2064> to them, walking<WG4043> on the sea,<WG2281> and would<WG2309> have passed<WG3928> by them.
But when they saw<WG1492> him walking<WG4043> on the sea,<WG2281> they supposed<WG1380> it had been<WG1511> a spirit,<WG5326> and cried<WG349> out:

For they all<WG3956> saw<WG1492> him, and were troubled.<WG5015> And immediately<WG2112> he talked<WG2980> with them, and said<WG3004> to them, Be of good cheer:<WG2293> it is I; be not afraid. <WG5399>

And he went<WG305> up to them into<WG1519> the ship;<WG4143> and the wind<WG417> ceased:<WG2869> and they were sore<WG3029> amazed<WG1839> in themselves<WG1438> beyond<WG1537> <WG4053> measure,<WG4053> and wondered.<WG2296>
For they considered<WG4920> not the miracle of the loaves:<WG740> for their heart<WG2588> was hardened.<WG4456>
And when they had passed<WG1276> over,<WG1276> they came<WG2064> into<WG1909> the land<WG1095> of Gennesaret,<WG1082> and drew<WG4358> to the shore.<WG4358>
And when they were come<WG1831> out of the ship,<WG4143> straightway<WG2112> they knew<WG1921> him,

And ran<WG4063> through<WG4063> that whole<WG3650> region<WG4066> round<WG4066> about,<WG4066> and began<WG756> to carry<WG4064> about<WG4064> in beds<WG2895> those<WG3588> that were sick,<WG2192> <WG2560> where<WG3699> they heard<WG191> he was.

And wherever<WG3699> <WG302> he entered,<WG1531> into<WG1519> villages,<WG2968> or<WG2228> cities,<WG4172> or<WG2228> country,<WG68> they laid<WG5087> the sick<WG770> in the streets,<WG58> and sought<WG3870> him that they might touch<WG680> if<WG2579> it were but the border<WG2899> of his garment:<WG2440> and as many<WG3745> as touched<WG680> him were made<WG4982> whole.<WG4982>
